info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 13 at 10:39AM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Jefferson and northwestern Franklin Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1038 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Valier, or near Christopher, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Jefferson and northwestern Franklin Counties, including the following locations... Ewing, Ina, North City, Belle Rive and Buckner. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 74 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
